page.title: 16Felmersham Nature Reserve
page.content: This reserve is 53 acres of peace and beauty. Following the{extraction of gravel from riverside fields in the 1940's, shallow lakes with islands were formed. The islands and margins have been colonised by a wealth of vegetation. The deliberate creation of marsh, woodland and grassland habitats by the{Beds & Hunts {Naturalist Trust}has further enhanced the site. The reserve attracts many leisure seekers. For the{angler}there are course fish, possibly including 25lb. pike; for the{country lover,}tranquil walks in fragrant meadows inhabited by butterflies, dragonflies and damsel flies; the{serious naturalist}may find bee orchids, bean aphids or grasshopper warblers.
